content:
Scenario: Neighborhood council service recognized as civic care contribution
    Given Frank serves on his neighborhood council
    And he attends meetings, participates in decisions, and contributes expertise
    And council service requires time, knowledge, and commitment
    When the neighborhood_elohim tracks civic participation
    Then Frank's council service should be quantified as care labor
    And meeting attendance and preparation time should be valued
    And his construction expertise contributions should be recognized
    And governance participation should accumulate care tokens
    And Frank should experience himself as valued neighborhood leader
    And civic engagement should be recognized as care economy contribution
    And his voice in neighborhood governance should carry appropriate weight
